intro: Myrsine youngii, commonly known as the New Zealand myrsine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a small evergreen shrub that typically grows in the understorey of temperate rainforests in New Zealand. The plant features simple, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green in color. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels and are followed by red, fleshy berries. Myrsine youngii plays an important ecological role, providing food for native birds and insects.
